golden_markdown:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT

DATE OF PROCEDURE: 2026-01-15
CC Referred Physician: Referring MD

INDICATION FOR OPERATION:
The patient who presents with Mediastinal staging for pulmonary nodule.
CONSENT: Obtained before the procedure. Its indications and potential complications and alternatives were discussed with the patient or surrogate. The consent was witnessed by an assisting medical professional.

PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS: Pulmonary nodule with mediastinal adenopathy
POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS: Same

PROCEDURE(S): See procedure details below

CPT CODES (candidates - verify locally): Not available; verify locally

ATTENDING: Alex Clinician, MD
ASSISTANT: None

ANESTHESIA: See chart
MONITORING: Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and BP were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer.

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL:
A systematic linear EBUS mediastinal and hilar survey was completed. Sampling was performed using a 22G needle. ROSE was available.

The following lymph node stations were sampled for diagnostic and staging evaluation:
Stations targeted: 4R, 7.

Station: 4R
Size: 10.0 mm
Biopsy Tools: TBNA
Number of Passes: 3

Station: 7
Size: 12.0 mm
Biopsy Tools: TBNA
Number of Passes: 4

Overall ROSE Diagnosis: Adequate lymphoid tissue. No immediate complications were observed, and post-procedure airway patency was preserved.

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS: Minimal
COMPLICATIONS: None

SPECIMEN(S): Not collected

IMPRESSION/PLAN:
Await final cytology and stage-directed oncology follow-up.

golden_markdown:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT

DATE OF PROCEDURE: 2026-01-20
CC Referred Physician: See chart

INDICATION FOR OPERATION:
The patient who presents with Pleural effusion with chronic cough.
CONSENT: Obtained before the procedure. Its indications and potential complications and alternatives were discussed with the patient or surrogate. The consent was witnessed by an assisting medical professional.

PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS: Left pleural effusion
POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS: Left pleural effusion, status post thoracentesis

PROCEDURE(S): See procedure details below

CPT CODES (candidates - verify locally): Not available; verify locally

ATTENDING: Taylor Operator, MD
ASSISTANT: None

ANESTHESIA: See chart
MONITORING: Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and BP were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer.

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL:
Thoracentesis was performed on the left hemithorax under ultrasound guidance.
Ultrasound identified a moderate pleural effusion with
anechoic echogenicity and minimal loculations.
Following sterile prep and local anesthesia,
a thoracentesis kit was used to access the pleural space at the
7th intercostal space along the posterior axillary line.
A total of 1200 mL of serous fluid was removed.
Samples were sent for protein, LDH, cytology. A post-procedure chest x-ray was ordered. The patient tolerated the procedure well without immediate complications.

Ultrasound identified a pleural effusion on the left side. Following sterile prep and local anesthesia, thoracentesis was performed at the 7th intercostal space along the posterior axillary line.
A total of 1200 mL of serous fluid was removed. Specimens were sent for protein, LDH, cytology. A post-procedure chest x-ray was ordered. CHEST ULTRASOUND FINDINGS:
Hemithorax: Left
Echogenicity: anechoicLoculations: minimalThe patient tolerated the procedure well without immediate complications.

BRONCHOSCOPY NOTE

PROCEDURE: Flexible bronchoscopy with Bronchoalveolar Lavage, Ultrasound-guided Thoracentesis, Thoracentesis (Detailed)OPERATORS: Taylor Operator, MDINDICATIONS: Pleural effusion with chronic cough
Informed consent obtained. A time out was performed prior to procedure.
Sedation with anesthesia per procedural record. Vitals were continuously monitored throughout the procedure.

FINDINGS:
Comprehensive airway survey without obstructing lesion. Right Lung: Patent bronchi to segmental level. Left Lung: Patent bronchi with mild secretions suctioned. Mucosa: Mild chronic inflammation, no active bleeding. Secretions: Scant clear secretions. Additional procedure details:
Bronchoalveolar lavage was performed in the RML medial segment.
A total of 100 mL of normal saline was instilled with
55 mL returned.
Samples were sent for cell count, culture, cytology.

Summary:
Pharynx: Not assessed due to Bronch introduction via ETT/Trach Tube
Larynx: Not assessed due to Bronch introduction via ETT/Trach Tube
Vocal Cords: Not assessed due to Bronch introduction via ETT/Trach Tube
Trachea: Distal 1/3 Normal
Right Lung: Patent bronchi to segmental level.
Left Lung: Patent bronchi with mild secretions suctioned.
No evidence of mass, lesions, bleeding, or other endobronchial pathology.
Mucosa: Mild chronic inflammation, no active bleeding.
Secretions: Scant clear secretions. Suctioned to clear.

The flexible bronchoscope was retracted and removed.
The patient tolerated the procedure well with no immediate complications.

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS: Minimal
COMPLICATIONS: None

SPECIMEN(S): Not collected

IMPRESSION/PLAN:
Monitor respiratory status and review pleural studies.

extraction.follow_up_plan: Follow pathology and arrange thoracic oncology clinic follow-up.

golden_markdown:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT

DATE OF PROCEDURE: 2026-01-22
CC Referred Physician: See chart

INDICATION FOR OPERATION:
The patient who presents with Peripheral right upper lobe nodule.
CONSENT: Obtained before the procedure. Its indications and potential complications and alternatives were discussed with the patient or surrogate. The consent was witnessed by an assisting medical professional.

PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS: RUL pulmonary nodule
POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS: RUL pulmonary nodule, sampled

PROCEDURE(S): See procedure details below

CPT CODES (candidates - verify locally): Not available; verify locally

ATTENDING: Jordan Navigator, MD
ASSISTANT: None

ANESTHESIA: See chart
MONITORING: Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and BP were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer.

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL:
Robotic navigation bronchoscopy was performed using the Intuitive Ion platform. A navigation plan from the pre-procedure CT was loaded and registration completed. The catheter was advanced under navigational guidance to the planned target. Radial EBUS demonstrated a concentric pattern at the target. Cone-beam CT was obtained for trajectory confirmation and correction as needed. Sampling was then performed through the extended working channel. Hemostasis was confirmed, and the patient tolerated the procedure without immediate complications.

Ventilation Parameters:
- Mode: VC
- RR: 14
- TV: 450 mL
- PEEP: 8.0 cm H₂O
- FiO2: 40%
- Flow Rate: 30 L/min- Pmean: 12.0 cm H₂O

Radial endobronchial ultrasound demonstrated an concentric view with lesion size 18.0 mm.
The probe was withdrawn leaving the guide sheath in situ. Sampling was performed via the guide sheath (1.9 mm) using forceps, needle, brush with 3 forceps, 2 needle, 1 brush.
Fluoroscopy used: Yes. ROSE: adequate sample. Specimens: pathology, cytology, microbiology. Post-procedure chest x-ray: per clinical indication. The patient tolerated the procedure well.

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS: Minimal
COMPLICATIONS: None

SPECIMEN(S): Not collected

IMPRESSION/PLAN:
Follow pathology and arrange thoracic oncology clinic follow-up.
